string.value: You've lost your #t1912011#! What should you do?

#p2020007# tells you to gather materials to make another #t1912011# and to also pay a service fee of #b10 million mesos#k for the replacement. What?!

#b10,000,000 mesos#k
#i4000048# #t4000048# #b#c4000048# / 50#k
After paying the huge service fee and gathering all the materials, you received another #t1912011# from #p2020007#. Better not lose it again!
Oh hey there fellow rider! How's your wolf? Hmmm…it looks like something's missing. Did you lose your #t1912011#? Oh no…you can't ride without a saddle…

There's no choice but for me to make you another #t1912011#, but I have something to explain first. Last time, I made the saddle for free just so I could ride around with you. But this time, you'll have to pay me a #bservice fee#k. Got it?

Now please bring me the #b50 #t4000048#s#k needed to make a #t1912011#, along with the #b10 million mesos#k service fee. Too expensive? Hahaha. Well, I consider myself one of the elites in this field.
Hmmm… is that a no? That's unfortunate. I liked having someone to talk about wolf mounts with.
Ohh, you did bring all the materials. Can you also hand me the service fee? Alright, time to make a #t1912011#.
Okay, here's the #t1912011#. If you happen to lose it again, then by all means come see me. Now let's go ride around!
I don't think you have the mesos and the materials all ready. I need #b50 #t4000048#s#k for the #t1912011#, just like last time, along with #b10 million mesos as a service fee#k.
